Breakfast.Name: Idli with Sambar, Coconut Chutney

Instructions: Grease the idli molds with oil.
Pour the idli batter into each mold.
Steam the idlis for 10-12 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean.

Ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrot, beans, potato, drumstick)
Instructions: Cook toor dal until soft and mash it.
In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, asafoetida, and curry leaves.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add tomatoes and cook until they turn soft.
Add mixed vegetables, tamarind extract, sambar powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Mix in the mashed dal and let it simmer for 10 minutes.
Blend grated coconut, roasted chana dal, green chilies, ginger, tamarind, and salt into a smooth paste.
In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal, asafoetida, and curry leaves.
Pour the tempering over the coconut mixture and mix well.

Breakfast.Note: Enjoy your Idli with Sambar and Coconut Chutney!

Lunch.Name: Quinoa Pulao with Vegetables, Chicken Curry

Instructions: Cook quinoa and set aside.
Sauté mixed vegetables and chicken in a pan.
Mix quinoa with sautéed vegetables and chicken.
Season with spices and herbs.
Sauté onions and tomatoes.
Add chicken pieces and cook until done.
Season with spices and herbs.

Lunch.Note: Enjoy your Quinoa Pulao with Vegetables and Chicken Curry!

Snack.Name: Fruit Salad with Amla, Walnuts

Instructions: Dice mixed fruits and Amla.
Mix fruits and Amla, top with walnuts.

Snack.Note: Enjoy your Fruit Salad with Amla and Walnuts!

Dinner.Name: Roti with Paneer Curry, Lentil Soup, Cabbage Thoran

Instructions: Sauté onions and tomatoes.
Add paneer pieces and cook until done.
Season with spices and herbs.
Cook lentils with vegetables.
Season with spices and herbs.
Sauté cabbage with coconut, mustard seeds, and curry leaves.

Dinner.Note: Enjoy your Roti with Paneer Curry, Lentil Soup, and Cabbage Thoran!

Breakfast.Name: Dosa with Coconut Chutney, Banana, Milk

Instructions: Heat a non-stick pan.
Pour a ladle full of dosa batter and spread it in a circular motion.
Cook until the edges turn golden brown.
Serve hot.
Blend coconut, roasted chana dal, green chilies, ginger, and salt into a smooth paste.
In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal, asafoetida, and curry leaves.
Pour the tempering over the coconut mixture and mix well.

Breakfast.Note: Enjoy your Dosa with Coconut Chutney, Banana, and Milk!

Lunch.Name: Quinoa Pulao with Vegetables, Chicken Curry

Instructions: Cook quinoa and set aside.
Sauté mixed vegetables and chicken in a pan.
Mix quinoa with sautéed vegetables and chicken.
Season with spices and herbs.
Sauté onions and tomatoes.
Add chicken pieces and cook until done.
Season with spices and herbs.

Lunch.Note: Enjoy your Quinoa Pulao with Vegetables and Chicken Curry!

Snack.Name: Mixed Nuts and Seeds
Instructions: Mix the almonds, walnuts, chia seeds, pumpkin seeds, and sunflower seeds in a bowl.
Ensure they are well combined for a variety of flavors and nutrients.
Enjoy a handful of this nutritious mix as a snack!
Snack.Note: A wholesome and tasty snack to boost your energy!

Dinner.Name: Roti with Paneer Curry, Lentil Soup, Cabbage Thoran

Instructions: Sauté onions and tomatoes.
Add paneer pieces and cook until done.
Season with spices and herbs.
Cook lentils with vegetables.
Season with spices and herbs.
Sauté cabbage with coconut, mustard seeds, and curry leaves.

Dinner.Note: Enjoy your Roti with Paneer Curry, Lentil Soup, and Cabbage Thoran!

Breakfast.Name: Pongal with Coconut Chutney, Kiwi, Milk

Instructions: Cook rice and moong dal together until soft.
In a separate pan, add ghee, pepper, and cumin, and temper the Pongal.
Blend coconut, roasted chana dal, green chilies, ginger, and salt into a smooth paste.
In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal, asafoetida, and curry leaves.
Pour the tempering over the coconut mixture and mix well.

Breakfast.Note: Enjoy your Pongal with Coconut Chutney, Kiwi, and Milk!

Lunch.Name: Brown Rice with Mixed Vegetable Curry, Fish Curry, Spinach Stir-Fry, Curd

Instructions: Cook brown rice.
Sauté mixed vegetables and add spices and herbs.
Sauté onions and tomatoes.
Add fish pieces and cook until done.
Season with spices and herbs.
Sauté spinach with mustard seeds, urad dal, red chili.

Lunch.Note: Enjoy your Brown Rice with Mixed Vegetable Curry, Fish Curry, Spinach Stir-Fry, and Curd!

Snack.Name: Sundal, Handful of Almonds, Tea or Coffee

Instructions: Cook chickpeas.

Snack.Note: Enjoy your Sundal with a handful of Almonds, and Tea or Coffee!

Dinner.Name: Chapati with Dal, Egg Curry, Green Salad, Buttermilk

Instructions: Cook toor dal until soft and mash it.
Sauté onions and tomatoes.
Add mashed dal and cook for 10 minutes.
Boil eggs and set aside.
Sauté onions and tomatoes.
Add boiled eggs and cook for 10 minutes.
Dice cucumber, tomatoes, lettuce, and carrots.
Mix in a bowl, add lemon juice, salt, and pepper.

Dinner.Note: Enjoy your Chapati with Dal, Egg Curry, Green Salad, and Buttermilk!

Breakfast.Name: Upma with Vegetables, Guava, Buttermilk

Instructions: Roast semolina until golden brown.
In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves, and sauté mixed vegetables.
Add roasted semolina, salt, and water. Cook until the upma is done.

Breakfast.Note: Enjoy your Upma with Vegetables, Guava, and Buttermilk!

Lunch.Name: Millet Roti with Egg Curry, Chickpea Salad, Spinach Poriyal, Curd

Instructions: Mix millet flour, water, and salt to form a dough.
Make small balls and roll them into rotis.
Cook on a hot griddle until done.
Boil eggs and set aside.
Sauté onions and tomatoes.
Add boiled eggs and cook for 10 minutes.
Boil chickpeas and let them cool.
Dice cucumber, tomatoes, and onions.
Mix chickpeas and diced vegetables, add lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Sauté spinach with mustard seeds, urad dal, red chili, and coconut.

Lunch.Note: Enjoy your Millet Roti with Egg Curry, Chickpea Salad, Spinach Poriyal, and Curd!

Snack.Name: Banana Smoothie with Almond Butter, Mixed Nuts, Tea or Coffee

Instructions: Blend banana, almond butter, milk, honey, and ice cubes until smooth.

Snack.Note: Enjoy your Banana Smoothie with Almond Butter, Mixed Nuts, and Tea or Coffee!

Dinner.Name: Quinoa Khichdi, Chicken Stir-Fry with Bell Peppers, Cucumber Raita, Buttermilk

Instructions: Cook quinoa and lentils together until soft.
Sauté mixed vegetables and add spices and herbs.
Mix quinoa and lentils with sautéed vegetables.
Stir-fry chicken strips with bell peppers and onions.
Add soy sauce, ginger-garlic paste, and season with spices and herbs.
Grate cucumber and mix with yogurt.
Add roasted cumin powder, coriander leaves, and salt.

Dinner.Note: Enjoy your Quinoa Khichdi, Chicken Stir-Fry with Bell Peppers, Cucumber Raita, and Buttermilk!

Breakfast.Name: Rava Kesari with Nuts, Orange, Milk

Instructions: Roast semolina in ghee until golden brown.
In a separate pan, heat water and sugar to make a syrup.
Slowly add the roasted semolina to the syrup, stirring continuously to avoid lumps.
Garnish with nuts.

Breakfast.Note: Enjoy your Rava Kesari with Nuts, Orange, and Milk!

Lunch.Name: Brown Rice with Lentil Curry, Grilled Fish, Cabbage Thoran, Curd

Instructions: Cook brown rice.
Cook lentils until soft and mash them.
Sauté onions and tomatoes, add spices and herbs.
Mix mashed lentils with sautéed vegetables.
Marinate fish fillets with lemon juice, olive oil, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Grill until cooked through.
Shred cabbage and sauté with mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves, and green chilies.
Add coconut and cook until the cabbage is tender.

Lunch.Note: Enjoy your Brown Rice with Lentil Curry, Grilled Fish, Cabbage Thoran, and Curd!

Snack.Name: Masala Chai with Whole Grain Crackers, Greek Yogurt with Honey

Instructions: Boil tea leaves, water, and spices in a pot.
Add milk and sugar, simmer for a few minutes, and strain.

Snack.Note: Enjoy your Masala Chai with Whole Grain Crackers, Greek Yogurt with Honey!

Dinner.Name: Chapati with Palak Paneer, Dal Tadka, Carrot and Beetroot Salad, Buttermilk

Instructions: Mix whole wheat flour, water, and salt to form a dough.
Make small balls and roll them into chapatis.
Cook on a hot griddle until done.
Blanch spinach and puree it.
Sauté onions and tomatoes.
Add spinach puree, paneer, and season with spices and herbs.
Cook toor dal until soft and mash it.
Sauté onions, tomatoes, and garlic.
Add mashed dal and season with mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and spices.
Grate carrots and beetroot.
Mix with lemon juice, salt, pepper, and garnish with coriander leaves.

Dinner.Note: Enjoy your Chapati with Palak Paneer, Dal Tadka, Carrot and Beetroot Salad, and Buttermilk!

Breakfast.Name: Oats Upma with Vegetables, Apple, Buttermilk

Instructions: Roast oats until golden brown.
In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves, and sauté mixed vegetables.
Add roasted oats, salt, and water. Cook until the upma is done.

Breakfast.Note: Enjoy your Oats Upma with Vegetables, Apple, and Buttermilk!

Lunch.Name: Quinoa Salad with Chickpeas, Mutton Curry, Broccoli Stir-Fry, Curd

Instructions: Cook quinoa and chickpeas.
Dice cucumber, tomatoes, and red onion.
Mix cooked quinoa, chickpeas, and diced vegetables.
Add lemon juice, olive oil, salt, pepper, and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.
Sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes, cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add mutton pieces, spices, and herbs. Cook until the mutton is tender.
Finish by adding yogurt and simmer for a few minutes.
Sauté broccoli florets and garlic in sesame oil.
Add soy sauce, salt, and pepper. Stir-fry until broccoli is tender.

Lunch.Note: Enjoy your Quinoa Salad with Chickpeas, Mutton Curry, Broccoli Stir-Fry, and Curd!

Snack.Name: Fruit Chaat with Chaat Masala, Trail Mix, Tea or Coffee

Instructions: Dice assorted fruits and mix them in a bowl.
Add chaat masala, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Toss well.
Garnish with fresh mint leaves.
Mix assorted nuts, dried fruits, and seeds in a bowl.
Sprinkle with your favorite spices.
Boil water and add tea leaves or coffee powder.
Add milk and sugar if desired. Strain and serve.

Snack.Note: Enjoy your Fruit Chaat with Chaat Masala, Trail Mix, and Tea or Coffee!

Dinner.Name: Roti with Aloo Gobi, Lentil Soup, Capsicum Raita, Buttermilk

Instructions: Mix whole wheat flour, water, and salt to form a dough.
Make small balls and roll them into rotis.
Cook on a hot griddle until done.
Sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes, cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add potatoes, cauliflower, spices, and herbs. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Cook lentils until soft and mash them.
Sauté onions, tomatoes, carrots, celery, and garlic.
Add mashed lentils and season with spices and herbs.
Dice capsicum and mix with yogurt.
Add roasted cumin powder, coriander leaves, and salt.

Dinner.Note: Enjoy your Roti with Aloo Gobi, Lentil Soup, Capsicum Raita, and Buttermilk!

Breakfast.Name: Kuzhi Paniyaram with Coconut Chutney, Mango, Filter Coffee

Instructions: Mix idli batter with finely chopped onions, mustard seeds, urad dal, and curry leaves.
Heat the paniyaram pan, add oil in each mold, and pour the batter.
Cook until golden brown on both sides.
Blend grated coconut, roasted chana dal, green chilies, ginger, tamarind, and salt into a smooth paste.
In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal, and curry leaves.
Pour the tempering over the coconut mixture and mix well.

Breakfast.Note: Enjoy your Kuzhi Paniyaram with Coconut Chutney, Mango, and Filter Coffee!

Lunch.Name: Sambar Sadam, Fish Curry, Avarakkai Poriyal, Curd Rice

Instructions: Cook rice and toor dal. In a pan, add mustard seeds, urad dal, asafoetida, and curry leaves.
Add mixed vegetables, sambar powder, tamarind extract, and cooked toor dal.
Mix well and serve.
Sauté onions until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes.
Add chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, tamarind extract, and water.
Add fish pieces and cook until done.
Chop avarakkai and cook until tender.
In a pan, add oil, mustard seeds, urad dal, green chilies, and curry leaves.
Add cooked avarakkai and coconut. Mix well.
Cook rice and let it cool. Mix curd and milk in a bowl.
In a pan, add oil, mustard seeds, urad dal, ginger, green chilies, and curry leaves.
Mix the tempering with curd and rice. Add salt and serve.

Lunch.Note: Enjoy your Sambar Sadam, Fish Curry, Avarakkai Poriyal, and Curd Rice!

Snack.Name: Murukku with Tea or Coffee, Fresh Pineapple

Instructions: Mix rice flour, urad dal flour, gram flour, butter, sesame seeds, cumin seeds, asafoetida, and salt.
Add water and knead the dough. Make murukku shapes and deep fry.

Snack.Note: Enjoy your Murukku with Tea or Coffee and Fresh Pineapple!

Dinner.Name: Chettinad Chicken Curry with Chapathi, Keerai Masiyal, Onion Raita

Instructions: Sauté onions until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes.
Add chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and garam masala.
Add chicken pieces and cook until done. Garnish with curry leaves.
Mix whole wheat flour, water, and salt to form a dough.
Make small balls and roll them into chapatis.
Cook on a hot griddle until done.
Blanch spinach and moong dal. Blend into a coarse paste.
In a pan, add oil, cumin seeds, garlic, and green chilies.
Add the spinach mixture and salt. Cook until it reaches a thick consistency.
Chop onion and coriander leaves.
Mix with curd, cumin powder, and salt.

Dinner.Note: Enjoy your Chettinad Chicken Curry with Chapathi, Keerai Masiyal, and Onion Raita!

Breakfast.Name: Adai with Avocado Chutney, Papaya, Buttermilk

Instructions: Soak rice and dals for a few hours. Grind into a coarse batter with red chili, curry leaves, asafoetida, and salt.
Heat a pan, spread the batter, and cook until both sides are golden brown.
Blend avocado, coconut, green chilies, ginger, lemon juice, and salt into a smooth chutney.
In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal, and curry leaves. Pour the tempering over the chutney.

Breakfast.Note: Enjoy your Adai with Avocado Chutney, Papaya, and Buttermilk!

Lunch.Name: Bisi Bele Bath with Eggplant Curry, Carrot Kootu, Curd Rice

Instructions: Cook rice and toor dal. In a pan, add mixed vegetables, tamarind extract, Bisi Bele Bath powder, jaggery, and salt.
Mix the cooked rice and dal. In a tempering pan, add ghee, mustard seeds, urad dal, cashews, and curry leaves.
Pour the tempering over the Bisi Bele Bath.
Sauté onions until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes.
Add chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt.
Add eggplant pieces and cook until done. Garnish with mustard seeds, urad dal, and curry leaves.
Cook carrots and moong dal. In a blender, grind coconut, green chilies, and cumin seeds into a paste.
Add the paste to the cooked carrots and moong dal. In a pan, add oil and curry leaves for tempering.
Cook rice and let it cool. Mix curd and salt with the rice.

Lunch.Note: Enjoy your Bisi Bele Bath with Eggplant Curry, Carrot Kootu, and Curd Rice!

Snack.Name: Masala Chai with Medu Vada, Banana

Instructions: Boil tea leaves, water, and spices in a pot.
Add milk and sugar, simmer for a few minutes, and strain.
Soak urad dal for a few hours. Grind into a smooth batter with green chilies, ginger, and salt.
Add curry leaves, cumin seeds, and pepper to the batter. Shape into vadas and deep fry until golden brown.

Snack.Note: Enjoy your Masala Chai with Medu Vada and Banana!

Dinner.Name: Kothamalli Rice with Chicken Gravy, Beetroot Pachadi, Cucumber Buttermilk

Instructions: Chop coriander leaves, green chilies, and ginger.
In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, and asafoetida.
Add the seasoning to the cooked rice. Add lemon juice and mix well.
Heat oil in a pan. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until the raw smell disappears.
Add tomatoes and cook until the oil separates from the masala.
Add chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and garam masala. Mix well.
Add chicken pieces and cook until they are well-coated with the masala.
Pour enough water, add curry leaves, and let it simmer until the chicken is cooked thoroughly.
Grate the beetroot and cook until it becomes soft.
In a blender, mix coconut, green chilies, mustard seeds, and urad dal into a fine paste.
Combine the beetroot, cooked rice, and the coconut mixture. Mix well.
In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal, and curry leaves for tempering. Pour over the pachadi.
Grate the cucumber and finely chop ginger and green chilies.
In a bowl, mix curd and water to make buttermilk. Add grated cucumber, ginger, and green chilies.
In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves, and a pinch of asafoetida for tempering.
Pour the tempering over the buttermilk mixture.

Dinner.Note: Enjoy your Kothamalli Rice with Chicken Gravy, Beetroot Pachadi, and Cucumber Buttermilk!

Breakfast.Name: Ven Pongal with Coconut Chutney, Orange, Nuts Mix, Filter Coffee

Instructions: Roast rice and moong dal until they turn golden brown.
In a pressure cooker, add roasted rice, moong dal, black pepper, cumin seeds, ginger, and water. Cook until soft.
In a pan, heat ghee, add cashews and curry leaves. Add the seasoning to the cooked pongal. Add salt to taste.

Breakfast.Note: Enjoy your Ven Pongal with Coconut Chutney, Orange, a mix of nuts, and Filter Coffee!

Lunch.Name: Vegetable Biryani, Mutton Curry, Bhindi Masala, Curd Rice, Mixed Nuts

Instructions: Soak basmati rice in water for 30 minutes.
In a pan, heat ghee, add cashews and raisins, and fry until golden brown. Set aside.
In the same pan, sauté onions until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until the raw smell disappears.
Add tomatoes, biryani masala, mint leaves, and coriander leaves. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add mixed vegetables and sauté for a few minutes.
In a separate bowl, mix yogurt and saffron strands soaked in milk.
In a pressure cooker, layer soaked rice, vegetable mixture, and yogurt mixture. Cook until the rice is done.
Garnish with fried cashews and raisins before serving.
Sauté onions until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until the raw smell disappears.
Add tomatoes and cook until they are soft.
Add mutton pieces, chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and garam masala. Mix well.
Add curry leaves and cook until the mutton is tender. Add water if needed.
Chop bhindi into pieces. Sauté in oil until they are cooked and slightly crispy. Set aside.
In the same pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves.
Add chopped onions, green chilies, and ginger. Sauté until onions are golden brown.
Add tomatoes, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook until tomatoes are soft.
Add the sautéed bhindi to the mixture. Mix well and cook for a few more minutes.
Cook rice and let it cool. Mix curd and salt with the rice.
Add a mix of nuts to enhance the flavor.

Lunch.Note: Enjoy your Vegetable Biryani, Mutton Curry, Bhindi Masala, Curd Rice, and a mix of nuts!

Snack.Name: Sprouts Salad with Pistachios, Tea or Coffee, Mixed Nuts

Instructions: Boil mixed sprouts until they are tender. Let them cool.
Dice cucumber, tomatoes, and onions.
In a bowl, mix sprouts, diced vegetables, green chilies, lemon juice, chat masala, and pistachios.
Garnish with pistachios before serving.
Boil water and add tea leaves or coffee powder.
Add milk and sugar if desired. Strain and serve.
Mix a variety of nuts and seeds for a wholesome and crunchy snack.

Snack.Note: Enjoy your Sprouts Salad with Pistachios, Tea or Coffee, and a mix of nuts!

Dinner.Name: Chapati with Raita, Fish Fry, Tomato Rasam, Buttermilk, Mixed Nuts

Instructions: Mix whole wheat flour, water, and salt to form a dough.
Make small balls and roll them into Chapatis.
Cook on a hot griddle, adding ghee as needed, until both sides are golden brown.
Dice cucumber, tomatoes, and onions.
In a bowl, mix curd, diced vegetables, chopped green chilies, coriander leaves, cumin powder, salt, and mixed nuts.
Marinate fish fillets with red chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, and salt.
Coat the marinated fish with rice flour and deep fry until golden brown.
Boil tomatoes until they are soft. Mash them well.
In a pot, add tamarind extract, rasam powder, turmeric powder, asafoetida, and salt.
Add the mashed tomatoes and bring it to a boil.
In a tempering pan, heat ghee, add mustard seeds, and curry leaves. Pour over the rasam.
Garnish with coriander leaves before serving.
In a bowl, mix curd and water to make buttermilk.
Add salt, cumin powder, and asafoetida.
In a tempering pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, finely chopped ginger, and mixed nuts. Pour over the buttermilk.
Mix a variety of nuts and seeds for a wholesome and crunchy snack.

Dinner.Note: Enjoy your Paratha with Raita, Fish Fry, Tomato Rasam, Buttermilk, and a mix of nuts!

Breakfast.Name: Ragi Idiyappam with Tomato Thokku, Apple, Nuts Mix, Buttermilk

Instructions: Mix ragi flour, salt, and water to form a soft dough.
Press the dough through an idiyappam maker to make thin strands.
Steam the ragi idiyappam until cooked.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Add chopped onions, green chilies, and ginger-garlic paste. Sauté until onions are golden brown.
Add tomatoes, red chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.

Breakfast.Note: Enjoy your Ragi Idiyappam with Tomato Thokku, Apple, a mix of nuts, and Buttermilk!

Lunch.Name: Coconut Rice with Fish Curry, Drumstick Sambar, Beans Poriyal, Curd Rice, Mixed Nuts

Instructions: In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, and curry leaves.
Add grated coconut and sauté until it turns golden brown.
Mix the seasoned coconut with cooked rice. Add salt to taste.
Marinate fish pieces with salt and turmeric powder. Fry until golden brown. Set aside.
In a pan, add mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Add chopped onions, green chilies, and ginger-garlic paste. Sauté until onions are golden brown.
Add tomatoes, coriander powder, turmeric powder, chili powder, and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add tamarind extract and bring it to a boil. Add the fried fish pieces and simmer until the curry thickens.
Cook toor dal until soft and mash it.
In a pot, add drumsticks, sambar powder, tamarind extract, onions, tomatoes, green chilies, and salt. Cook until drumsticks are tender.
Add the mashed dal and bring it to a boil.
In a tempering pan, add oil, mustard seeds, urad dal, and curry leaves. Pour over the sambar. Garnish with coriander leaves.
Chop beans into small pieces. Cook until they are tender.
In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves, and green chilies.
Add grated coconut and sauté. Add the cooked beans and salt. Stir well.

Lunch.Note: Enjoy your Coconut Rice with Fish Curry, Drumstick Sambar, Beans Poriyal, Curd Rice, and a mix of nuts!

Snack.Name: Pazham Pori with Tea or Coffee, Watermelon, Mixed Nuts

Instructions: Mix maida, rice flour, turmeric powder, sugar, and salt in a bowl. Add water to make a thick batter.
Peel bananas and dip them in the batter. Fry until golden brown.

Snack.Note: Enjoy your Pazham Pori with Tea or Coffee, Watermelon, and a mix of nuts!

Dinner.Name: Paruppu Usili with Vatha Kuzhambu, Radish Sambar, Snake Gourd Poriyal, Buttermilk, Mixed Nuts

Instructions: Soak toor dal, chana dal, and red chilies. Grind into a coarse paste with asafoetida and turmeric powder.
Steam the ground paste for 10-15 minutes.
In a pan, add mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves, and chopped beans. Sauté until the beans are cooked.
Crumble the steamed dal mixture and add it to the sautéed beans. Mix well.
In a pan, add tamarind extract, sambar onions, garlic, curry leaves, sambar powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook until the raw smell disappears.
In a tempering pan, add oil, mustard seeds, and urad dal. Pour over the kuzhambu.
Cook toor dal until soft and mash it.
In a pot, add radish, sambar powder, tamarind extract, onions, tomatoes, green chilies, and salt. Cook until radish is tender.
Add the mashed dal and bring it to a boil.
In a tempering pan, add oil, mustard seeds, urad dal, and curry leaves. Pour over the sambar. Garnish with coriander leaves.
Peel and chop snake gourd into small pieces. Cook until they are tender.
In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves, and green chilies.
Add grated coconut and sauté. Add the cooked snake gourd and salt. Stir well.

Dinner.Note: Enjoy your Paruppu Usili with Vatha Kuzhambu, Radish Sambar, Snake Gourd Poriyal, Buttermilk, and a mix of nuts!

Breakfast.Name: Kothu Parotta with Salna, Pineapple, Filter Coffee

Instructions: Shred the parottas into small pieces.
In a pan, sauté onions, tomatoes, bell peppers, and curry leaves.
Add ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, chili powder, and garam masala.
Add shredded parottas and mix well. Add salt to taste.
Make a well in the center, break eggs, and scramble. Mix everything together.
Garnish with coriander leaves.
In a pan, sauté onions, green chilies, and ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomatoes and cook until they are soft.
Add mixed vegetables, turmeric powder, chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook until the vegetables are tender.
Add garam masala and coriander leaves. Mix well.

Breakfast.Note: Enjoy your Kothu Parotta with Salna, Pineapple, and Filter Coffee!

Lunch.Name: Tomato Rice with Fish Fry, Vazhakkai Varuval, Kathirikkai Pachadi, Curd Rice

Instructions: In a pan, add oil, mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, and cashews.
Add chopped onions, green chilies, and ginger-garlic paste. Sauté until onions are golden brown.
Add tomatoes, turmeric powder, chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Cook until tomatoes are soft.
Mix the seasoned mixture with cooked rice. Add salt to taste.
Marinate fish fillets with lemon juice, turmeric powder, chili powder, coriander powder, and ginger-garlic paste.
In a bowl, mix rice flour and corn flour. Coat the marinated fish with the flour mixture.
Deep fry until the fish is golden brown. Garnish with curry leaves.
Peel and slice raw bananas.
In a bowl, mix turmeric powder, chili powder, coriander powder, rice flour, and salt.
Coat the banana slices with the spice mixture.
Deep fry until the banana slices are crisp and golden brown.
Chop brinjals, onions, and tomatoes.
In a pan, add oil, mustard seeds, urad dal, cumin seeds, and curry leaves.
Add chopped onions, green chilies, and tomatoes. Sauté until they are soft.
Add brinjals and cook until they are tender.
Beat yogurt and add it to the mixture. Add salt to taste.

Lunch.Note: Enjoy your Tomato Rice with Fish Fry, Vazhakkai Varuval, Kathirikkai Pachadi, and Curd Rice!

Snack.Name: Sundal with Tea or Coffee, Pomegranate, Mixed Nuts

Instructions: Soak chickpeas overnight and cook until they are soft.
In a pan, add oil, mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves, and green chilies.
Add cooked chickpeas, coconut, asafoetida, and salt. Mix well.

Snack.Note: Enjoy your Sundal with Tea or Coffee, Pomegranate, and a mix of nuts!

Dinner.Name: Chettinad Vegetable Curry with Parotta, Keerai Masiyal, Onion Raita, Mixed Nuts

Instructions: Chop mixed vegetables, onions, tomatoes, and coriander leaves.
In a pan, add oil, mustard seeds, urad dal, cumin seeds, and fennel seeds.
Add chopped onions, green chilies, and curry leaves. Sauté until onions are golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomatoes, and coriander leaves. Cook until tomatoes are soft.
Add mixed vegetables, turmeric powder, chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Add coconut and salt. Mix well.
In a bowl, mix all-purpose flour, wheat flour, and salt.
Add water gradually and knead into a soft dough.
Make small balls and roll them into thin discs. Apply oil on each disc and layer them.
Roll the layered discs into a parotta and cook on a hot griddle until done.
Blanch spinach and moong dal. Grind into a coarse paste with garlic and green chilies.
In a pan, add oil and the ground mixture. Cook until it reaches a thick consistency.
Add salt to taste.
Chop onions and coriander leaves.
Mix them with curd and add salt to taste.

Dinner.Note: Enjoy your Chettinad Vegetable Curry with Parotta, Keerai Masiyal, Onion Raita, and a mix of nuts!
